intro: Chuquiraga retinens, commonly known as the Andean burclover, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, hairy pods that contain seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in high-altitude environments. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects in arid regions.
